solution_line_template: When Alice invested her money in the stock market, her money doubled to ${initial_investment}*{alice_multiplier} = $<<{initial_investment}*{alice_multiplier}={alice_final}>>{alice_final}
Bob, after investing in real estate, increased his money by {initial_investment}*{bob_multiplier} = <<{initial_investment}*{bob_multiplier}={bob_profit}>>{bob_profit}
The total amount of money that Bob made after investing in real estate is ${bob_profit}+${initial_investment} = $<<{bob_profit}+{initial_investment}={bob_final}>>{bob_final}
Bob made ${bob_final}-${alice_final} = $<<{bob_final}-{alice_final}={difference}>>{difference} more than Alice after investing his money.
